section1.good_choice_reason2: serve as a fantastic protein source

section2.user_goals: reduce added sugar, reduce sodium, and increase vegetable intake
section2.goal_feedback1: Great work! You made significant progress in increasing your vegetable intake. This was due to your purchases of Fresh Roma Tomato and Great Value Cut Green Beans, both of which are rich in vitamins and minerals.
section2.goal_feedback_items1: Fresh Roma Tomato and Great Value Cut Green Beans
section2.goal_feedback2: Some choices this week didn’t align with your goal to reduce added sugar. You purchased Hawaiian Punch Lemonade Juice, which raised your added sugars score because of its high sugar content.
section2.goal_feedback3: Some choices this week didn’t align with your goal to reduce sodium. You purchased Kraft House Italian Lite Salad Dressing, which contributed to a higher sodium level due to its concentration of sodium.
section2.goal_feedback_items3: Kraft House Italian Lite Salad Dressing

section3.fruits_explanation: Fresh Gala Apples and additions like Sliced Bananas contributed to a perfect fruit score. These fruits are crucial for vitamins, minerals, and fiber, supporting your health with their nutritious profile. Keep including a variety of fruits!
section3.vegetables_explanation: Fresh Roma Tomato and Green Beans helped you excel in vegetable intake. Vegetables are essential for vitamins and minerals and low in calories, supporting overall health. Keep it up!
section3.grains_explanation: While Quaker Quick Oats contributed to a high whole grain score, the overall grain variety was limited. Consuming a variety of whole grains can provide lasting energy and nutrition throughout the day. Try including more whole grains next week!
section3.dairy_explanation: Items like Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk and Greek Yogurt were excellent choices for dairy. Dairy provides essential calcium and supports bone health. Continue enjoying these sources!
section3.protein_explanation: The inclusion of Ground Turkey and Black Beans for plant proteins provided a balanced approach to protein intake. Protein is essential for muscle building and overall health. Keep it diverse with plant-based options too!
section3.fattyacids_explanation: The purchase of Great Value Reduced Fat Mayonnaise with Olive Oil contributed positively, though the score reflects room to include more healthy fats. Healthy fats are vital for brain function and reducing heart disease risk. You might benefit from including more sources like fish or nuts.

section4.refinedgrains_explanation: Your selection minimized refined grains with choices like Minute Instant White Rice. Limiting refined grains helps maintain stable blood sugar levels. Well done!
section4.sodium_explanation: Kraft Italian Lite Salad Dressing contributed to a higher sodium score. High sodium intake can increase blood pressure, so it’s important to be mindful of salt consumption. Aim for low-sodium options next time.
section4.addedsugars_explanation: The low presence of sugary items like Juices shows great control over added sugar intake. High sugar intake can cause weight gain and dental problems. Keep it up!
section4.saturatedfats_explanation: Land O Lakes Butter did not overly impact the score. Limiting saturated fats reduces the risk of heart issues. Excellent balance here!

section5.recommendation1: Hawaiian Punch Lemonade Juice contributed to a negative added sugars score. Next week, try unsweetened iced tea or flavored water to strengthen your score.
section5.recommendation2: Kraft House Italian Lite Salad Dressing contributed to a negative sodium score. Next week, try using vinegar-based dressings or creating homemade dressings with fresh herbs.
section5.food_to_substitute2: Kraft House Italian Lite Salad Dressing
section5.recommendation3: Minute Instant White Rice contributed to a lower whole grain score. Next week, substitute with brown rice or quinoa to enhance your score.
